sen.j: 敦子内親王（あつこないしんのう、生年不詳 - 延長 (元号)8年1月13日 (旧暦)（930年2月14日））は、平安時代中期の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Atsuko (the birth date unknown - February 14, 930) was a member of the Imperial Family in the mid Heian period.
Imperial Princess Atsuko (the birth date unknown - February 14, 930) was a member of the Imperial Family during the mid Heian period.
Imperial Princess Atsuko (year of birth unknown - February 19, 930) was a member of the Imperial Family during the mid Heian period.
sen.cmt: 用語統一グレゴリオ歴に変更

sen.e: She served as Kamo-Saiin (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines)
She served as Kamo-Saiin (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines)
She served as Kamo-Saiin (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines)
She was the third imperial princess of the Emperor Seiwa.
She was the third imperial princess of the Emperor Seiwa.
She was the third imperial princess of the Emperor Seiwa.

sen.j: 母は女御藤原高子（贈太政大臣藤原長良女）。
sen.e: Her mother was nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court (a consort of an emperor) FUJIWARA no Takaiko (a daughter of FUJIWARA no Nagara, zo daijo daijin (the Grand Minister, posthumously conferred).
Her mother was nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court (a consort of an emperor) FUJIWARA no Takaiko (a daughter of FUJIWARA no Nagara, zo daijo daijin (the Grand Minister, posthumously conferred).
Her mother was nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court (a consort of an emperor) FUJIWARA no Takaiko (a daughter of FUJIWARA no Nagara, zo daijo daijin (the Grand Minister, posthumously conferred).

sen.j: 陽成天皇・貞保親王の同母姉妹。
sen.e: She was a sister-uterne of the Emperor Yozei and Imperial Prince Sadayasu.
She was a sister-uterne of Emperor Yozei and Imperial Prince Sadayasu.
She was a sister-uterine of Emperor Yozei and Imperial Prince Sadayasu.

sen.j: 清和源氏の祖とされる貞純親王は異母兄弟。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Sadazumi, who is said to be an ancestor of Komu Heishi (the Taira family), is her paternal brother.
Imperial Prince Sadazumi, who is said to be an ancestor of Komu Heishi (the Taira family), is her paternal brother.
Imperial Prince Sadazumi, who is said to be an ancestor of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan), is her paternal brother.

sen.j: 兄陽成天皇の即位に伴い、元慶元年（877年）2月17日賀茂斎院に卜定される。
sen.e: With the enthronement of her elder brother, the Emperor Yozei, she was appointed as Kamo-Saiin (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines) on February 17, 877.
With the enthronement of her elder brother, the Emperor Yozei, she was appointed as Kamo-Saiin (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines) on February 17, 877.

With the enthronement of her elder brother, the Emperor Yozei, she was appointed as Kamo-Saiin (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Kamo-jinja Shrines) by bokujo (to decide by fortunetelling) on March 9, 877.
sen.cmt: by bokujo (to decide by fortunetelling)補足グレゴリ暦に

sen.j: 元慶4年（880年）4月11日に紫野院に入る。
sen.e: She entered Murasakinoin on April 11, 880.
She entered Murasakinoin on April 11, 880.
She entered Murasakinoin on May 27, 880.

sen.j: 同年12月、父清和上皇の崩御により退下。
sen.e: She resigned when her father the retired Emperor Seiwa died in December, 880.
She resigned when her father the retired Emperor Seiwa died in December, 880.
She resigned when her father the Retired Emperor Seiwa died in January, 881.
sen.cmt: 用語統一グレゴリ暦に

sen.e: She died on February 14, 930.
sen.cmt: 新暦では930年2月14日と上にありますので、合わせて新暦で訳しました。
sen.e: She died on February 14, 930.
She died on February 19, 930.
